title: High Public-Private Investment in Energy
description: In 2020, Tanzania attracted $1,200,000 in public-private partnerships for energy projects, showcasing its commitment to energy sector development.

title: Low Patent Applications by Nonresidents
description: In 2015, Tanzania recorded only 1 patent application by nonresidents, indicating limited foreign innovation activity.

title: Negative Changes in Inventories
description: In 2023, Tanzania experienced a significant reduction in inventories, valued at -3,192,498,275,300 LCU, reflecting potential economic challenges.

title: High Pupil-Teacher Ratio in Preprimary Education
description: In 2017, Tanzania had a pupil-teacher ratio of 113.97 in preprimary education, indicating overcrowded classrooms.

title: Older Starting Age for Lower Secondary Education
description: In 2023, the starting age for lower secondary education in Tanzania was 14 years, which is higher than many countries.

title: Low Advanced Education in Male Labor Force
description: In 2020, only 28.71% of Tanzania's male working-age population had advanced education, highlighting a gap in higher education.

title: Low Advanced Education in Total Labor Force
description: In 2020, 29.63% of Tanzania's total working-age population had advanced education, indicating a need for educational improvements.

title: Low Intermediate Education in Labor Force
description: In 2020, only 21.67% of Tanzania's working-age population had intermediate education, suggesting limited vocational training.

title: High Bound Rate for Manufactured Products
description: In 2021, Tanzania had a bound rate of 120% for manufactured products, indicating high trade protectionism.
